snippet: The drug maker Mylan is suing the Food and Drug Administration in an attempt to upend its rival Ranbaxy’s exclusive rights to produce a generic form of Diovan, a blood pressure drug.
abstract: Generic drug maker Mylan sues the Food and Drug Administration in an attempt to upend rival Ranbaxy's exclusive rights to produce generic form of blood pressure drug Diovan; FDA has still not given final clearance to Ranbaxy, months after the patent for the top-selling drug expired.
lead_paragraph: The drug maker Mylan is suing the Food and Drug Administration in an attempt to upend its rival Ranbaxy’s exclusive rights to produce a generic form of Diovan, a blood pressure drug.

headline.seo: Mylan Sues F.D.A. Over Ranbaxy’s Rights to Diovan
headline.main: Lawsuit Challenges Ranbaxy’s Rights to Generic Drug
headline.print_headline: Lawsuit Challenges Ranbaxy’s Rights to Generic Drug
